meanings.definition: A barrier set up on a website that requires payment before access to content is granted.
meanings.sent1: Some websites use paywalls to make money from their articles.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't read the full article because of the paywalls on the site.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky paywalls were like bouncers at a club, only letting in those with cash.
meanings.sent4: The paywalls stood tall like gates to a treasure trove, keeping out those without coins.
meanings.sent5: The paywalls were like toll booths on the information highway, demanding a fee for passage.

meanings.definition: The act of restricting access to online content until payment is made.
meanings.sent1: Many news websites rely on paywalls to earn revenue.
meanings.sent2: The paywalls prevented me from reading the entire research paper.
meanings.sent3: The paywalls played hard to get, teasing users with locked content.
meanings.sent4: Her subscription was the key to unlock the digital paywalls around the articles.
meanings.sent5: The paywalls were like digital gatekeepers, guarding the valuable content within.
